property.caption: Pan to context
property.description: If set to true, if the dataview object changes, the map will pan automatically to the accompanying marker. In this case, the widget will assume that the contextobject contains a lat and long attribute.

property.caption: Default latitude
property.description: Default latitude for the map to start at.

property.caption: Default longitude
property.description: Default longitude for the map to start at.

property.caption: Minimal zoom level
property.description: Minimum a user can zoom (0 or higher))

property.caption: Maximal zoom level
property.description: Maximum a user can zoom (20 or lower)

property.caption: Single item zoom level
property.description: The zoom level used when displaying a single item. 1 is the whole world, 15 is city level, 20 is house level.

property.caption: Refresh on entity changes
property.description: This option refreshes all the markers when an object of the corresponding entity is changed/added/removed. This will retrieve the entire list of objects everytime and map them again. Be aware that this might give performance issues when mapping big amounts or mapping a frequently used entity.

property.caption: Objects
property.description: The objects to show on the map.

property.caption: XPath Constraint
property.description: The XPath constraint on the objects.

property.caption: Marker attribute
property.description: The attribute that will be displayed in the marker info bubble. (Not required)

property.caption: Marker category
property.description: Category of the marker. This will be used as a label in conjunction with "Show categories" in Controls (Not required)

property.caption: Latitude attribute
property.description: The latitude attribute.

property.caption: Longtitude attribute
property.description: The longtitude attribute.

property.caption: On click microflow
property.description: The microflow to execute when clicking on a Marker

property.caption: Marker image key
property.description: Used to find the image associated with specified key in the marker images.

property.caption: Height
property.description: The map's height in px or percent. Note: If you set the map height to a certain percentage, make sure the container surrounding the widget has a certain height.

property.caption: Width
property.description: The map's width in px or percent.

property.caption: Marker template
property.description:
If you set the Marker attribute (Data Source), you can control what the popup will contain. Use '{Marker}' as the value of your marker attribute (this will be replaced). Example: "

{Marker}

"

property.caption: Default marker image
property.description: The default image to use if no value is specified in the attribute used for the marker image key (see data source tab).

property.caption: Marker images
property.description: Marker images related to the keys from the specified key attribute (see data source tab).

property.caption: Key
property.description: The enum key as string (empty '' enum values are not recognized, use the default icon for this).

property.caption: Image
property.description: Image shown when marker image key attribute contains the key for this image.

property.caption: Maptype
property.description: Set the default map type. See http://leaflet-extras.github.io/leaflet-providers/preview/index.html for examples. Note: not all providers have been implemented, due to HTTPS restrictions. Mapbox can be used through a custom URL.

property.caption: Use custom map type
property.description: Use a custom Map Type. You need to set a Custom Map Url. Instructions: http://leafletjs.com/reference.html#tilelayer

property.caption: Custom Map Url
property.description: Set an url for custom map type

property.caption: Custom Map Options
property.description: Set the options for the custom map. This has to be a valid object ({}) with "key":"value" pairs, divided by commas. See options: http://leafletjs.com/reference.html#tilelayer

property.caption: HERE App Id
property.description: If you want to use HERE maps, you need an App Id. Get one here: http://developer.here.com/

property.caption: HERE App Code
property.description: If you want to use HERE maps, you need an App Code. Get one here: http://developer.here.com/

property.caption: Google Maps Key
property.description: For the Search (GeoCoder) function, we can use a Google maps key to do searches.

property.caption: Mapbox Access Token
property.description: For the Search (GeoCoder) function, we can use an Access Token for Mapbox.

property.caption: Add geocoder (search)
property.description: This will add a search button to your map to find a location

property.caption: Mouse dragging
property.description: Drag the map using the mouse

property.caption: Touch zoom
property.description: Zoom by touch-dragging with two fingers (mobile)

property.caption: Mouse scrolling
property.description: Zoom by using the mouse wheel

property.caption: Zoom control
property.description: Add zoom control to the map (+/- button)

property.caption: Attribution control
property.description: Add attributions to the map (credits)

property.caption: Fullscreen control
property.description: Add fullscreen button to the map

property.caption: Show categories
property.description: Add a layers button to the map (to switch categories on and off). You will need to set the "Marker category" in Data Source for this.

property.caption: Add geolocation button
property.description: This will find your location on the map using geolocation

property.caption: Draw an uncertainty circle
property.description: Draw a circle around the geolocation point to show the uncertainty

property.caption: Keep zoom level
property.description: When locating, keep the current zoom level. If set to false, it will use the max zoom

property.caption: Add scale
property.description: Show a scale on the map

property.caption: Max width
property.description: Max width of the control in pixels, this is set dynamically to show round values

property.caption: GeoJSON Entity
property.description: Entity for a GeoJSON.

property.caption: GeoJSON Content attribute
property.description: Attribute that contains the JSON

property.caption: GeoJSON Microflow
property.description: Load GeoJSON files in your map. The microflow should return a list.

property.caption: GeoJSON Feature entity
property.description: Entity that is mapped to GeoJSON Feature. This should be non-persistable.

property.caption: GEOJSON Feature ID attribute
property.description: Attribute that is used for identification

property.caption: On feature click microflow
property.description: Microflow that will be triggered by clicking on a feature. If you set the Feature Entity and Attribute, it will create a new object and pass it to the microflow.

property.caption: On feature click
property.description: Microflow that will be triggered by clicking on a feature.

property.caption: Access token
property.description: A valid ArcGIS access token should be present in this attribute.

property.caption: Feature server
property.description: A URL to an ArcGIS feature server.

property.caption: Selected Object Attribute
property.description: The selected objectID will be stored in this attribute

property.caption: Search IDs Object Attribute
property.description: This attribute should contain a comma-separated string of object IDs to render.

property.caption: Create Point
property.description: If set to true, the map will have a button to create a new point. The coordinates for this point are sent to the context object attributes set below.

property.caption: New Point Lat
property.description: This attribute will be populated with a new point's latitude.

property.caption: New Point Long
property.description: This attribute will be populated with a new point's longitude.
